page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Headon has one of the oldest houses in Nottinghamshire. It is called { {AISLED},in modern english it translates as{OLD HOUSE}.There is also a moat behind Headon Manor. Three cannon balls have been found in and around Headon, probably from the Civil War in 1642. An ancient, large burial mound is in Gamston Wood. Saxon findings and a homestead have been unearthed at the corner of the wood. The name{Headon}comes from{Hai don} which means high hill.{NETHER}=lower, therefore Nether Headon =lower hill. Upton was Uptown, a farm settlement and is a more recent name than Headon. Askham originates from Ash, an old ash tree giving the settlement its origin. Headon Church was built in 1250.
